comments.text:
+Jack Simpson Anime is more of a medium than a genre; even though sci-fi 
and fantasy elements are popular, maturity, realism, and overall style run 
the gamut as much as live action film and television do. There are plenty 
of anime that make sense on their own terms, like how The Matrix makes 
sense for the Matrix franchise or how giant eagles with complex politics 
make sense for Lord of the Rings.

Death Note, Fullmetal Alchemist*, Berserk*, YuYu Hakusho, and Baccano!* are 
just a handful of anime that would be pretty accessible for a newcomer. 
It's best to start with some mainstream series before you veer off into 
insanity like Code Geass: Lord of Anime Tropes, Gurren Lagann, or FLCL. 

Also: For the record, gratuitous fanservice is one of the things I hate 
most about modern anime. That said, High School of the Dead is another 
series that's pretty accessible, but at the same time it ODs on fanservice 
from minute one. Its chemical formula would be something like "zombies plus 
boobs," with guns as a catalyst.

Also: Also: I'm not sure starting with a web series whose status as "anime" 
is, shall we say, debatable, was the best place to test the anime waters. 
It's kind of like wondering, "Do I like sitcoms?" and then marathoning 
College Humor videos. But that's just my two cents.

*The characters in Fullmetal Alchemist, Berserk, and Baccano! have Anglican 
(read: not Japanese) names, so there wouldn't be a ton of words to get 
confused over. We're talking Ed(ward) [Fullmetal Alchemist], Griffith 
[Guts], and Isaac [Baccano!]. Just so you know. Bottom line: Lots of 
variety out there. Don't give up just because you're not used to Japanese.

comments.text:
+edwin echevarria I call Avatar anime. It's becoming less of "Japanese 
Animation" and more a descriptor for various animated styles that share a 
certain set of characteristics. No offense intended, but I think the region 
of origin is a poor reason to label something. Imagine any given anime had 
been made in the west, it still looked exactly the same and had the same 
plot. Does is no longer have the defining trait that made it "Anime"? I'm 
not saying this is universally true, but among my circle we are starting to 
broaden the use of the word, and we're bringing back "Japanime" for the 
strict classification some purists use for just anime.

for Nora, who confesses her feelings to him right before he dies then 
rushes towards the enemy and taking out dozens of them at a time before she 
succumbs to her wounds. Slowly the Hunters and Huntresses all fall until 
only team RWBY are left, fighting with everything they have. The group 
slowly get separated and surrounded. They fight honorably, but in the end 
the sheer amount of enemies they face is too much and they fall. They all 
die in a blaze of glory in a battle worthy of the gods. It will be a good 
day to die.

And when they're all dead, the camera slowly pans to show the counsoler 
saying 'Director, another fragment has been made'"

captions.text:
♪ This will be the day
we're waiting for. ♪

♪ This will be the day
we open up the door. ♪

♪ I don't wanna hear
your absolution. ♪

♪ We'll be ready
for a revolution. ♪

♪ Welcome to a world
of new solutions ♪

♪ Welcome to a world of
bloody evolution ♪

♪ In time your heart
will open minds ♪
♪ A story will be told ♪

♪ And victory is in
a simple soul. ♪♪♪
- Ruby!
Over here!
I saved you a spot!
- Hey I gotta go!
I'll see you after the ceremony!
- Hey, wait!
Great.

Where am I supposed to
find another nice,
quirky girl to talk to?

- How's your first day
going, little sister?

- You mean since you ditched
me and I exploded!?

- Yikes.
Meltdown already?

- No, I literally exploded a
hole in front of the school...
There was a fire...
and I think some ice.
- Are you being sarcastic?
- Ugh, I wish!

I tripped over some
crabby girl's luggage!

And then she yelled at me!
And then I sneezed.

And then I exploded!
And then she yelled again!
And I felt really, really bad!

And I just wanted her
to stop yelling me!
- You!
- Oh god, it's happening again!

- You're lucky we weren't blown
off the side of the cliff!

- Oh my god, you
really exploded.
- It was an accident!
It was an accident!
What's this?

- The Schnee Dust Company is not
responsible for any injuries

or damages sustained
while operating
a Schnee Dust Company product.

Although not mandatory, the
Schnee Family highly encourages

their customers to read and
familiarize themselves with this

easy-to-follow guide to Dust
application and practice
in the field.
- Uhhh...

- You really want to start
making things up to me?
- Absolutely!

- Read this and don't
ever speak to me again.

- Look, it sounds like you two
got off on the wrong foot!

Why don't you just start over
and try to be friends, okay?
- Yeah! Great idea, Sis!

Hello, Weiss!
I'm Ruby!
Want to hang out?

We can go shopping
for school supplies!

- Yeah, and we can paint our
nails, and try on clothes,

and talk about cute boys,
like tall, blonde,
and scraggly over there!
- Oh wow, really?
- NO.
- Ahem... I'll keep this brief.

You have traveled here today
in search of knowledge.

To hone your craft and
acquire new skills.

And when you have finished,
you plan to dedicate your life

to the protection
of the people.

But I look amongst you and
all I see is wasted energy
in need of purpose, direction.

You assume knowledge will
free you of this
but your time at this school will prove that knowledge
can only carry you so far.

It is up to you to take
the first step.

- You will gather in
the ballroom tonight.
Tomorrow your initiation begins.
Be ready.
You are dismissed!

- He seemed kind of off,
almost like he wasn't there.
- I'm a natural blond, you know!
- It's like a big slumber party!

- I don't think dad would
approve of all the boys though.
- I know I do.
What's that?

- A letter to the
gang back at Signal.

I promised to tell them
all about Beacon
and how things are going.
- Aww, that's so cuuuuute!
- Shut up!

I didn't get to take my
friends with me to school.

It's weird not
knowing anyone here.
- What about Jaune?
He's nice!

There you go!
Plus one friend!
That's a 100 percent increase!

- I'm pretty sure Weiss
counts as a negative friend.
Back to zero.

- There's no such thing
as negative friends!

You just made one
friend and one enemy!
Look, it's only been one day.

Trust me, you've got
friends all around you.
You just haven't met them yet.
- That girl...
- You know her?
- Not really.

She saw what happened this
morning, but left before
I could say anything.
- Well, now's your chance!
- Hey, wait!
What are you doing?
- Helloooo!

I believe you two
may know each other!

- Aren't you the girl
that exploded.

- Uhh, yeah!
The name's Ruby.
But, you can call me...

actually you can
just call me Ruby.
- Okay.
- What are you doing?
- I don't know, help me.
- So... what's your name?
- Blake.
- Well, Blake, I'm Yang!
Ruby's older sister!
...I like your bow!
- Thanks.
- It goes great with your...
pajamas.
- Right.
- Nice night, don't you think?
- Yes.
It's lovely.
Almost as lovely as this book...
that I will continue to read...
as soon as you leave.

- Yeah, this girl's
a lost cause.
- What's it about?
- Huh?

- Your book.
Does it have a name?

- It's about a man with two
souls, each fighting
for control of his body.

- Oh, yeah...
that's real lovely...
- I love books.

Yang used to read to me
every night before bed.

Stories of heroes
and monsters...

they're one of the reasons
I want to be a Huntress.
- Why is that?

Hoping you'll live
happily ever after?
- I'm hoping we all will.

As a girl, I wanted to be just
like the heroes in the books.

Someone who fought for what was
right, and protected the people
who couldn't protect themselves.

- That's very
ambitious for a child.

Unfortunately, the real world
isn't the same as a fairy tale.
- Well that's why we're here...
to make it better.

- Ohhh, I'm so proud
of my baby sister!
- Cut it out!

- Well, Ruby, Yang...
it's a pleasure to-

- What in the world is
going on over here!?

Don't you realize some of
us are trying to sleep!?
- (both) Oh, not you again!

- Shh! Guys, she's right!
People are trying to sleep!
- Oh, now you're on my side.
- I was always on your side!

- Yeah, what's your problem
with my sister?
She's only trying to be nice!
- She's a hazard to my health!

♪ Don't you worry
about the world ♪

♪ Gonna light up the night
with the love in my heart ♪

♪ I will burn
like the sun ♪

♪ I will keep you
safe from harm ♪

title: RWBY Episode 3: The Shining Beacon, Pt.2
